description: Billions of dollars of gold is smuggled out of Africa every year, with the vast majority exported to the United Arab Emirates for processing, according to a report by SwissAid.
title: Billions in African Gold Smuggled to UAE Yearly, SwissAid Says

description: Thailand is entering a new phase of political uncertainty that threatens further damage to the nation’s fragile financial markets.
title: Thailand Heads for Fresh Political Turmoil as Thaksin Indictment Looms

description: North Korea fired multiple suspected ballistic missiles on Thursday, just days after leader Kim Jong Un’s space program was dealt a blow when a rocket blew up soon after liftoff.
title: North Korea Fires Ballistic Missiles Days After Rocket Fails

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, Treasury and economic policy reporter Christopher Condon looks at US efforts to isolate Russia. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: US Takes Aim at China to Put Pressure on Russia Over War in Ukraine

description: A fresh round of trade restrictions under a Donald Trump administration would serve as a negative supply shock to the US economy, potentially boosting inflation and forestalling Federal Reserve interest rate cuts into next year, according to Deutsche Bank AG.
title: Trump’s Tariff Threat Set to Derail Rate Cuts, Deutsche Bank Says

description: Top Republicans are warning the Biden administration against tapping into the nation’s strategic oil reserve to bring down gasoline prices with five months to go before the presidential election.
title: Republicans Warn Biden Against Tapping Oil Reserve as Gas Prices Rise

description: President Joe Biden told Black voters the balance of the Supreme Court was at stake in his November rematch against Republican Donald Trump as he sought to shore up his standing with a key part of his electoral coalition.
title: Biden Tells Black Voters He’ll Pick ‘Progressive’ Supreme Court

description: An incoming government will have to cut spending, raise taxes or borrow more. The finance sector is worried about what that could mean for it.
title: Reeves Looks to Woo Bankers Wary of a Labour UK Takeover

description: South Africa’s electoral commission said it expects voter turnout in Wednesday’s election to be higher than in 2019, with citizens standing for hours in long queues waiting to cast their ballots.
title: South Africa Sees High Voter Turnout With Long Queues at Polls

description: The UK election campaign turned into a battle of contested economic dossiers, as Labour accused the Tories of risking a repeat of Liz Truss’s market turmoil — a direct response to the Conservatives’ disputed claim that Keir Starmer’s party has a £40 billion hole in its spending plans.
title: Labour Borrows Hunt’s Playbook to Attack Tory Spending Plans

description: US Supreme Court Justice Samuel Alito told lawmakers he won’t recuse from cases involving Donald Trump and the Jan. 6 Capitol riot after revelations that flags associated with far-right causes flew over his homes in Virginia and New Jersey.
title: Alito Rejects Democrats’ Calls to Step Away From Trump Cases

description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken stopped short of endorsing Ukraine’s use of US weapons to strike inside Russia but said the Biden administration will “adapt and adjust” as the war evolves.
title: Blinken Says US to ‘Adjust’ as Ukraine Moves to Strike in Russia

description: Texas House Speaker Dade Phelan held off a primary challenge with help from conservative mega-donor Miriam Adelson, whose family gambling empire has been pushing to legalize casinos in the state.
title: Adelson-Backed Texas House Speaker Holds Off Primary Challenger

description: The US Navy mishandled oversight of a $22 billion frigate program to replace the much-criticized and more vulnerable Littoral Combat Ship, according to a new congressional audit.
title: Navy ‘Botched’ Design Oversight of $22 Billion Frigate, Audit Finds

description: US Deputy Treasury Secretary Wally Adeyemo said Chinese firms must cease supplying components that can be utilized by Russia in weapons used to attack Ukraine or face consequences.
title: China Must Stop Aiding Russia Weapons Supply Chain, Adeyemo Says

description: President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva relocated Brazil’s ambassador from Israel to another post after months of diplomatic tensions over the country’s military campaign in the Gaza Strip.
title: Brazil Relocates Ambassador From Israel After Months of Tension

description: Germany’s ruling coalition plans to push ahead with pension reforms in the coming months to help cope with the demands of an aging population, including the creation of retirement savings accounts with favorable tax treatment.
title: Germany to Push Ahead With Pension Reforms After Summer Break

description: Argentina is scrambling to secure supplies of fuel as winter bites in the southern hemisphere with lower-than-expected temperatures boosting demand for home heating.
title: Argentina Faces Natural Gas Crunch With Colder Winter Setting In

description: Hungary’s prime minister is often the odd man out in the European Union and the NATO military alliance. Since Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, Viktor Orban has been essentially alone in pushing back against Western efforts to come to Kyiv’s aid. With the war now in its third year and Ukraine in dire need of assistance, the nationalist leader’s stonewalling is exasperating Hungary’s allies and raising questions about his government’s true allegiances.
title: Why Hungary’s Orban Is Stonewalling Allies Over Aid for Ukraine

description: President Javier Milei will pitch investing in Argentina to Apple Inc., Alphabet Inc. and Meta Platforms Inc. this week in California, building on an unprecedented wave of international recognition in a bid to fortify his political strength at home.
title: Milei Pitches Argentina to Silicon Valley After Setbacks at Home

description: Venezuelan opposition leaders said President Nicolás Maduro’s “arbitrary” decision to uninvite European Union election monitors raises concerns about the legitimacy of the July presidential vote.
title: Venezuela Opposition Blast Maduro’s Move to Bar EU Monitors

description: The European Union’s executive arm is examining the feasibility of a proposal by one of its member states to sanction Russia’s Ingosstrakh Insurance Co., as part of efforts to choke revenue generating streams that Moscow needs to finance its war against Ukraine.
title: EU Weighs Proposal to Sanction Russian Oil Tanker Insurer Ingosstrakh

description: Hamas probably won’t be defeated until the end of the year, Israel’s national security adviser said, underscoring the difficulty the country faces in achieving its stated aim of crushing the Islamist group in Gaza.
title: Israel Sees Seven More Months of Fighting in Gaza Until Hamas Is Crushed

description: Egypt’s government raised the price of subsidized bread for the first time in decades, taking aim at key public support measure which previous governments had shied away from for fear of stoking unrest.
title: Egypt Raises Subsidized Bread Price for First Time in Decades

description: A new pair of giant pandas will arrive in Washington by the end of the year, the Smithsonian Institution’s National Zoo announced Wednesday.
title: China to Send Two New Pandas to Washington’s Smithsonian Zoo

description: Voters arrive early morning at an IEC voting station in Nellmapius, east of Pretoria, on May 29. Photographer: Waldo Swiegers/Bloomberg
title: South Africa Votes in Tightest Election in 30 Years

description: Get caught up on the day’s political news
title: Do Views Mean Votes? Political Parties Get Creative On TikTok

description: Each day, Bloomberg journalists take you across a selection of towns and cities as they gear up for the big vote.
title: Angry Farmers And Separatist Khalistani Movement May Deprive Modi of India’s Punjab In Elections

description: Russian forces are trying to seize as much Ukrainian territory as possible in an effort to force Kyiv’s allies to agree to a freeze in fighting before weapons deliveries fill a crucial gap, a top aide to President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said.
title: Ukraine Sees Russia Land-Grab Attempt Before More Weapons Arrive

description: Junior doctors in England are set to walk out for five consecutive days ahead of the general election, having failed to reach an agreement with the Conservative government in an ongoing dispute over pay.
title: Junior Doctors Plan to Strike Ahead of UK General Election

description: Republicans boast their rich Senate candidates give them a $100 million advantage in critical races, but Democrats are attacking the baggage the political newcomers are bringing to the contests.
title: Rich GOP Senate Contenders Face Attacks Over China, Out-of-State Mansions

description: The European Union is aiming to start negotiations as early as June 25 with Ukraine on becoming a member of the bloc to help boost Kyiv’s morale, but has yet to fully overcome objections from Hungary.
title: EU Aims to Start Ukraine Membership Negotiations by End of June

description: Belgian investigators conducted searches at the European Parliament in Brussels on Wednesday morning over potential Russian interference.
title: Police Search EU Parliament Office in Russia Meddling Probe

description: Keir Starmer’s opposition Labour Party extended its poll lead over the Conservatives even as Rishi Sunak’s party unveiled a series of pledges intended to build momentum early in UK election campaigning, YouGov said.
title: Labour Poll Lead Grows Even After Tory Policy Blitz, YouGov Says

description: Investors see Mexico’s presidential election as a foregone conclusion, but the real possibilities for market volatility are lurking elsewhere on the ballot.
title: What Mexico’s Investors Are Watching Ahead of Elections

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: A Weakened ANC May Shake Up South Africa

description: After more than six weeks of proceedings, closing arguments in former President Donald Trump’s criminal hush-money trial wrapped up on Tuesday in lower Manhattan. On Wednesday, Judge Juan Merchan will give the 12-person panel instructions on how to apply the law to the case — known as a jury charge — and will dispatch them to begin their deliberations.
title: Jury Deliberates In Trump’s Hush-Money Trial. What Happens Next?

description: President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva wants to show off the Amazon’s reality when Brazil hosts a United Nations climate summit next year. For attendees, that means complicated journeys and precarious conditions.
title: Lula Will Have Hard Time Hosting UN Climate Delegates in Amazon

description: Sweden will provide two surveillance aircraft to Ukraine that’s fighting Russian attacks, as part of the largest military support package to date from the Nordic nation.
title: Sweden to Send Ukraine Saab Recon Aircraft in Largest Package

description: President Vladimir Putin appointed Alexey Dyumin to a top state post, continuing the rise of an official who was once his personal bodyguard.
title: Putin Moves His Ex-Bodyguard to Powerful State Post in Russia

description: A ship was hit by missiles for a second time while sailing through the Red Sea on Tuesday, the UK Maritime Trade Operations said.
title: Missiles Hit Ship Twice in a Day in Houthi-Ravaged Red Sea

description: The United Arab Emirates reached an agreement with South Korea to bolster bilateral commerce, adding Asia’s fourth-largest economy to a growing roster of nations to close trade deals with the wealthy Gulf state.
title: UAE and South Korea Sign Pact Aimed at Boosting Bilateral Trade

description: For years, the London Stock Exchange touted a link with China’s equity markets as an initiative that would give global investors access to the Asian nation’s growth through the UK. Yet almost five years since the mechanism was introduced, it has dropped off the radar.
title: The Forgotten UK-China Stock Connect Program Now Needs a Reboot

description: The rand will be one of the few South African assets trading through the country’s general election Wednesday, as investor optimism that drove a five-week rally gives way to caution over the risk of a surprise outcome.
title: Rand on Razor’s Edge as South Africans Vote in Pivotal Poll

description: QUETTA, Pakistan (AP) — A speeding passenger bus crashed off a mountainous highway and fell into a ravine in southwest Pakistan early Wednesday, killing at least 20 passengers, police and government officials said.
title: At Least 20 Dead After Speeding Bus Plunges Into Ravine in Pakistan

description: Incumbent Tony Gonzales won the Republican primary runoff for the 23rd Congressional District in Texas, AP said, surviving a primary challenge by a gun-rights advocate.
title: Gonzales Survives Republican Primary Runoff for Texas House Seat

description: When Daikin Industries Ltd., the Japanese air conditioning maker, began operating in India 25 years ago, it was importing finished units from Thailand and selling it to local consumers.
title: Modi Needs Tough Reforms in Third Term to Lure Foreign Firms

description: Customs agents at US airports have barred entry to at least 20 students and scholars with valid visas since November in ‘more insidious’ version of disbanded China Initiative.
title: Expulsions of Chinese Students Spread Confusion From Yale to UVA

description: The European Union’s banking ambitions are misguided and the bloc needs a reset to make it easier for banks to operate across borders, according to a German deputy finance minister.
title: EU Governments Need to Be Braver on Banking Rules, Toncar Says

description: A majority of European business leaders said the continent’s relationship with China will likely deteriorate over the next few years as challenges with trade and the geopolitical climate drive tensions.
title: Europe CEOs See China Ties Worsening Despite Economic Optimism

description: German Finance Minister Christian Lindner won’t yield to pleas from some of his cabinet colleagues for more money in next year’s budget and will stick firmly to his goal of enforcing strict borrowing rules, according to one of his deputies.
title: German Finance Minister Standing Firm on 2025 Budget Restraint

description: South Africans began voting in an election on Wednesday that looks set to reshape a political landscape dominated for three decades by the party that Nelson Mandela led to power.
title: South Africa Votes in Closest Election in Post-Apartheid Era

description: Swiss voters are growing skeptical toward proposed changes to the country’s health-care system, according to the last poll ahead of a June 9 ballot.
title: Swiss Support for Plan to Curb Health Costs Is Waning, Poll Says

description: Thai prosecutors decided to formally charge former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra in a royal defamation case, creating fresh legal risks for the head of the political dynasty that controls the country’s ruling party.
title: Former Thai PM Thaksin Will Be Indicted in Royal Insult Case

description: Mexico’s 2024 election is by far the most violent since 2018, with 749 people connected to the races affected by political violence that ranges from threats to kidnappings and murders.
title: Mexico Election Is Most Violent Since 2018 With 749 Victims

description: Leader Kim Jong Un said deploying spy satellites is essential to protect North Korea’s sovereignty after one of its rockets failed in flight, as his regime made good on a threat to drop “filth” on South Korea from balloons it sent over the border.
title: Kim Jong Un Pledges to Launch More Spy Satellites as North Korea Drops 'Filth' In South

description: A un día de que concluya el periodo de campañas en México, la candidata del partido gobernante, Claudia Sheinbaum, parece posicionada para obtener un buen resultado en las elecciones del próximo domingo, con una ventaja de 25 puntos
title: Elecciones México 2024: Sheinbaum mantiene su ventaja en la recta final

description: Just a day before campaigning ends, ruling party candidate Claudia Sheinbaum looks well positioned for a successful outcome in Sunday's election, with a 25-point lead
title: Mexico Election 2024: Sheinbaum's Lead Steadies in Final Days of Campaign

description: Donald Trump on Tuesday endorsed the primary opponent of Representative Bob Good, one of the most conservative Republicans in Congress and the chairman of the House Freedom Caucus.
title: Trump Endorses GOP Opponent of Top House Conservative Bob Good

description: A prosecutor at the Donald Trump hush-money trial urged a New York jury to consider a “mountain” of evidence showing the former president tried to influence the 2016 election by paying an adult-film star to stay silent about an alleged sexual encounter and then tried to cover his tracks.
title: Trump Prosecutor Urges Conviction Over Hush-Money Plot, Cover Up

description: President Xi Jinping will meet Arab leaders this week seeking deeper ties in a region where China does plenty of business — and increasingly diplomacy, too.
title: Xi Hosts Arab Leaders as China’s ‘Soft Power’ Expands in Mideast
